abstract.p: New York Islanders sign free agent forwards Robert Petrovicky, Jeff Toms and Jesse Belanger (S)

block.p: The Islanders yesterday signed three veteran free-agent forwards: Robert Petrovicky, Jeff Toms and Jesse Belanger.

Petrovicky, 27, a member of the Slovak Olympic team in 1994 and 1998, played in 43 games with Tampa Bay last season and had 7 goals and 17 points. Toms, 26, scored 1 goal and had 4 points in 20 games with the Washington Capitals last season.
The Islanders yesterday signed three veteran free-agent forwards: Robert Petrovicky, Jeff Toms and Jesse Belanger.

Petrovicky, 27, a member of the Slovak Olympic team in 1994 and 1998, played in 43 games with Tampa Bay last season and had 7 goals and 17 points. Toms, 26, scored 1 goal and had 4 points in 20 games with the Washington Capitals last season.
Belanger had 3 goals and 9 points in 16 games with the Montreal Canadiens. In 243 games in the National Hockey League, Belanger has 59 goals and 135 points.
RIGHT WING JOINS RANGERS: Jeff Ulmer, a right wing who played four years at the University of North Dakota, agreed to terms with the Rangers yesterday.

Ulmer, 23, started last season with the Canadian national team, scoring 15 goals and 25 assists in 40 games. He then turned professional with the Houston Aeros of the International Hockey League, coached by Ron Low, now coach of the Rangers. (AP)
